text: Hello, I have a background building distributed computers using python3 and asyncio, for processing large-computation work. I am evaluating Julia.

elements.text: Hello, I have a background building distributed computers using python3 and asyncio, for processing large-computation work. I am evaluating Julia.

text: MAybe you’ve already seen it but <https://github.com/JuliaPy/PyCall.jl|PyCall> might be useful for you! If you use Julia to handle the distributed-ness you can always call your existing python code

elements.text: MAybe you’ve already seen it but
might be useful for you! If you use Julia to handle the distributed-ness you can always call your existing python code

text: Thank you. I am starting out a new project, and do not expect to interop. But I do have a need for a serialisation/IPC mechanism. I have previously used thrift, but I don't think the Julia librry is there yet for thrift (evaluated it yesterday).

elements.text: Thank you. I am starting out a new project, and do not expect to interop. But I do have a need for a serialisation/IPC mechanism. I have previously used thrift, but I don't think the Julia librry is there yet for thrift (evaluated it yesterday).

text: You should check out Arrow.jl for serialization

elements.text: You should check out Arrow.jl for serialization

text: what's the status of 'native' protobuf and grpc support in Julia?

elements.text: what's the status of 'native' protobuf and grpc support in Julia?

text: <https://github.com/JuliaIO/ProtoBuf.jl> seems to work and is maintained.

elements.text: seems to work and is maintained.
